main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects occurred in Norfolk, VA, and near Lake Demp, VA, in 1954.
interesting points: The objects were described as disk-shaped, pale green in color, and were observed moving at a high speed of approximately 600 to 800 knots.
The pilot and observers felt that the objects were not of this world and could not be identified as any known aircraft.
A couple reported seeing a crescent-shaped metallic object hovering over the James River near Norfolk, VA, which they described as about 25 feet in diameter and moving at a slow speed.
Observations indicated that the objects did not resemble any known aircraft and seemed to be operating in a formation.
The pilot and observers saw 10 to 15 unidentified objects over Lake Demp, near ACCAP, and their outline was clearly defined.
location: Norfolk, VA and Lake Demp, VA
witnesses: multiple witnesses including military personnel and civilians
